intro: Euphrasia calida, commonly known as the warm euphrasia, is a flowering plant native to southern regions of the United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and a tendency to form low, spreading clumps.
